title: Pervaiz Malik visits Pak Arab Refinery Headquarters
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 30 (APP):Federal Minister for Petroleum, Ali Pervaiz Malik Friday visited the Corporate Headquarters of Pak-Arab Refinery Limited (PARCO).
He was received by Irteza Ali Qureshi, Managing Director, PARCO, along with the Company’s senior leadership team.
The minister was accompanied by the Additional Secretary (Policy), Petroleum Division Zafar Abbas, Deputy Secretary Waqas Barlas, said a news release.
During the visit, the Minister was given a comprehensive briefing on PARCO’s modular  growth strategy, its fifty-year legacy of operational excellence, and its future strategic roadmap.
The briefing highlighted PARCO’s vital role in strengthening Pakistan’s energy infrastructure through innovation, efficiency, and sustainability.
Ali Pervaiz Malik acknowledged the significance of PARCO’s contribution to Pakistan’s energy landscape. He highlighted Government’s priority for refinery Upgradation.
This will not only improve efficiency in the energy supply chain but also facilitate the transition towards clean energy. Pakistan is committed to uphold the standards of environmental protection and cleaner energy resources.
His visit underscored the government’s support for institutions like PARCO that are playing a pivotal role in meeting the country’s growing energy demand.
Government remains committed to fulfilling Pakistan’s energy needs and continues to align its efforts with the national vision for a secure, sustainable, and self-reliant energy future.
